data.title: British High Commission Maseru
data.meta_description: The British High Commission in Maseru maintains and develops relations between the UK and Lesotho.
data.text:
Find out more on our UK and Lesotho news page. You can also access UK government services while in Lesotho.

UK nationals needing consular assistance in Lesotho should contact British High Commission in Pretoria. There is no consular office at the British High Commission in Maseru.

If you’re travelling in Lesotho, read our Lesotho travel advice.

Get an emergency travel document

You can apply for an emergency travel document if you’re abroad and your passport has been lost or stolen, damaged or expired, and you can’t get a new or replacement passport in time to travel. Emergency Travel Documents for British Nationals in Lesotho are issued in South Africa; you may be required to pay for courier costs.

Apply online for an emergency travel document.

If the person needing the emergency travel document is under 16, a parent or guardian should apply on their behalf.

If you are travelling in more than 3 weeks, check if you can get a new or replacement passport in time to travel.

If you are not a British citizen or have not had a British passport before

If you’re not sure, check if you’re a British citizen.

If you’re not a British citizen but think you may be eligible, contact us to apply for an emergency travel document.

Other consular services

Notarial and documentary services

For legal reasons, we’re unable to carry out notarial acts in Commonwealth countries. This includes certifying documents as true copies of originals, administering oaths or taking affidavits. For these services or other notarial acts, you should contact a local notary. A standard letter is available to confirm we do not offer these services in Lesotho.

Consular fees

The British High Commission in Pretoria charge fees for some consular services. See the full list of consular fees in South Africa.

Development work in Lesotho
